snippet.textDisplay:
Seriously. Why are we making videos like this? This topic was a nightmare. How do you talk about a continent as diverse as Africa, to explain larger trends? Not only is there a wide variety of sources, experts disagree with each other on what they can predict about the future. So the time we took to rewrite this script over and over was insane.


Still, there is no chance this video won’t make people angry, on all sides of this issue. Some may not agree with the conclusions we have come to. Some will think there are other aspects we could and should have mentioned. Or lament that we generalized too much.


But we had to generalize or this video would just have become a hour-long documentary. And we think the topic is too important to not discuss it.


So we read a lot and talked too many experts with very different opinions and interpretations. Also we tried to prepare our sources in a way that walks you through our thought process and helps you to make up your own mind.


This video was sponsored by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation as part of a Grant. They did not take part in the production of the video though.


Sources and comments: https://sites.google.com/view/sourcesoverpopulationandafrica
snippet.textOriginal:

Still, there is no chance this video won’t make people angry, on all sides of this issue. Some may not agree with the conclusions we have come to. Some will think there are other aspects we could and should have mentioned. Or lament that we generalized too much. 


But we had to generalize or this video would just have become a hour-long documentary. And we think the topic is too important to not discuss it.


So we read a lot and talked too many experts with very different opinions and interpretations. Also we tried to prepare our sources in a way that walks you through our thought process and helps you to make up your own mind.

snippet.textDisplay:
Population is not the problem.

You're operating on the false premise that the rate of creation of resources is fixed. It's not.

What would help is if corporations there figured out how to do industrialized farming like in america.

One major problem is the prevalence of natural resources--it's given incentive to communist dictators to use power to force people to extract the resources, while destroying the rest of the economy for mere self-enrichment.
I refer you to CGP grey's video on the ingredients for a dictatorship. Natural resources are one.

snippet.textDisplay: Overpopulation is not Africa's problem. It's the rest of the world problem. That's why the world's wealthiest (who generally has been robbing the rich continent of its resources) are so worried. For a long time they even tried fueling local wars between parts of the continent — didn't help much. Population still grew fast. I'm not discarding the possibility that world's elite might stoop down to genocidal level atrocities in the future if nothing else helps.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think what Africa needs the most is cheap, unfiltered access to the Internet.

The internet provides tons of information, educational courses, ways to communicate with others all over the world, etc. All this new information could open their eyes to how the world really works. Online education is far cheaper than building all this new infrastructure for schools. Access to global communication could allow groups to better understand their states politics and make better decisions about their country.

I just fear that if this doesn’t happen in time that Africans will become the “useless class” that Yuval Harari always speaks about as technological advancements replace lower to upper class workers before Africans even got the chance to compete in the labor market.

Additionally, I think Africa is already selling itself out to China so it may already be over for Africans to ever make a name for themselves.

snippet.textDisplay:
FOR KURZGESAGT

The problem here in Africa is the education and the people's way of life because of it. Some people don't believe in it and instead become lazy and want everything for free without working. I am not trying to offend anyone, that is just my view from living in South Africa my whole life.

For example we have a lot of people who are not happy with the way our government leads our country , rightfully so. But then they just elect the same government party to lead , even though they only made things worse.
Others are also unhappy and expect it to change , but then they don't even go vote.

Back to education, we recently had a few strikes about education. Many people wanted new schools to be built and it is a good idea ,but what do they do to show that they're unhappy about the current education status?
They burn down another 4 schools...

It's problems like these that make Africa the way it is today, people make rash decisions , uneducated decisions and suffer the consequences therefore.

Take for example the high birthrate - There are loads of informal settlements (plakkerskampe) here is ZA with a lot of people living in them. The easiest solution to get out of those settlements is to have a lot of children.
More children mean the chances are higher that at least one will succeed , get an education and make a living.

And even when that one succeeds , he/she has to care for their family (brothers ,sisters, parents, uncle) of at least 10 people or more. Making it impossible to achieve higher.

There are also people who own a large portion of the country , mainly farmers, who get murdered because of racism, lowering the amount of food the country can produce.

Something to add to racism , at least a quarter of the country's population want to murder eachother , because one race wants the other to give them back their land which was stolen (but actually bought) in colonial times and also go back to where they came from.

We also recently began having something called "load shedding" , where we run without power for a few hours a day , because we put uneducated people at the lead of our power production, who made uneducated decisions and stole a massive amount of money from the country and in return cost it even more.

All of this applies to ZA , and might not apply to other African countries , many actually fight for their very existence because of poverty caused by the lack of education.

So to sum it up . The problem here in Africa is not stupid people it's the uneducated bad decisions , racism , corruption and horrible leaders caused by the lack of education.

Back to education, we recently had a few strikes about education. Many people wanted new schools to be built and it is a good idea ,but  what do they do to show that they're unhappy about the current education status?
They burn down another 4 schools...

It's problems like these that make Africa the way it is today, people make rash decisions , uneducated decisions and suffer the consequences therefore.

Take for example the high birthrate - There are loads of informal settlements (plakkerskampe) here is ZA with a lot of people living in them. The easiest solution to get out of those settlements is to have a lot of children.
More children mean the chances are higher that at least one will succeed , get an education and make a living.

And even when that one succeeds , he/she has to care for their family (brothers ,sisters, parents, uncle) of at least 10 people or more. Making it impossible to achieve higher.

There are also people who own a large portion of the country , mainly farmers, who get murdered because of racism, lowering the amount of food the country can produce. 

Something to add to racism , at least a quarter of the country's population want to murder eachother , because one race wants the other to give them back their land which was stolen (but actually bought) in colonial times and also go back to where they came from.

We also recently began having  something called "load shedding" , where we run without power for a few hours a day , because we put uneducated people at the lead of our power production, who made uneducated decisions and stole a massive amount of money from the country and in return cost it even more.

All of this applies to ZA , and might not apply to other African countries , many actually fight for their very existence because of poverty caused by the lack of education.

So to sum it up . The problem here in Africa is not stupid people it's the uneducated bad decisions , racism , corruption and horrible leaders caused by the lack of education.

snippet.textDisplay: To not even mention China's "investment" or I should say power-grab, when talking about Africa's future path is shortsighted and that's putting it kindly. You mentioned about colonisation from the past; the debt obligations that Africa will "owe" China once the infrastructure is in place will be enormous. I must say the fact that you didn't even mention this is scary - it shows China may well succeed with their plan to hold soft-power across the globe.

snippet.textDisplay:
The areas colonized by Europeans came out far better off than the areas left alone but now that they are left to govern themselves the infrastructure in many areas is breaking down because the people there have not yet become able to perform the required upkeep of what we left behind.
The worst thing Europe did was to send food and doctors/medicine instead sending exclusively books, teachers and contraceptives, the result was has been a huge boom in population which the countries/societies there are unable to care for.
Had we exclusively educated the people there they might have had a chance to grow their societies and cultures to support their population growth instead of causing this extreme over population with the all the conflict and problems it brought with it, both in Africa and in the other parts of the world to where the overflow is now migrating.

snippet.textDisplay:
Overpopulation is psuedo-science made famous by Dr. Paul Ehrlich. Thanks to his false prophecies, countries like India instituted mass sterilizations and China embarked on the greatest infanticide the world has ever known. In reality humankind is experiencing unheard of overabundance in food and goods. Turns out the biggest consumers in the world are also the biggest food wasters (US/UK). Famine such as the one in Ethiopia were the result of war not drought at all. That is to say man made.

The above video states sub-Saharan (or Black if you like) Africa needs aid when based on natural resources alone the Congo should be the richest nation on earth by far. What's more no country has ever been lifted out of poverty thanks to foreign food aid. It is a persistent myth based on racist colonial past and present day neo-colonialism. In short, say NO to white supremacy and imperialism.

snippet.textDisplay: Kurzgesagt if you were serious you'd factor in IQ. The average IQ of your example, Bangladesh, is 82. The average sub-Saharan IQ is 70 and some countries in Africa are in the 60s. I hate that all humans don't have comparable IQ but its a huge factor in productivity and civilizational stability. Ignoring the facts may make you feel good today but it won't help the 5 billion Africans in a few years when "...wow our projections were way off???"
snippet.textOriginal: Kurzgesagt if you were serious you'd factor in IQ. The average IQ of your example, Bangladesh, is 82. The average sub-Saharan IQ is 70 and some countries in Africa are in the 60s. I hate that all humans don't have comparable IQ but its a huge factor in productivity and civilizational stability. Ignoring the facts may make you feel good today but it won't help the 5 billion Africans in a few years when "...wow our projections were way off???"

snippet.textDisplay:
I live in South Africa, Adding to what was said in this video, People in Africa in general know what contraceptives are I.E. Condoms and Birth Control, But don't use it because of the price and other reasons, Moving on our crime rate is terrible not only because of corruption and a lack of jobs but also lack of education, Corruption in Africa happens EVERYWHERE, Think Government, Hospitals, Schools, Insurance Companies, Police Departments, Electrical Companies for the country, Home affairs, Licencing Department (Where you apply for Driving Test both Theoretical and Practical) and many more, Education in public schools are so bad that our minimum pass rate for High school is 40% on each subject with some subjects only requiring 30%, There are schools that push you to achieve higher marks but those are in expensive private schools most of the time, as such we have university students calling science "Magic" or "Black Magic" if i remember correctly, Investments into the country have been stolen or misused, Our Electrical Company owes Billions, Municipalities owe billions to our electrical company as well as other companies, Squatter Camps are all over the country with next to no infrastructure in a lot of them, Education in these camps also doesn't exist in a lot of them because schools are too far away and the parents cannot take then due to a lack of transportation.
There are more issues you can go into with Africa that will have to be solved to help alleviate the issues with overpopulation, But it is going to take a lot of money and a lot of new laws as well as a new way to enforce them as even the Military and Police Force are corrupt.


Welcome to Africa.
snippet.textOriginal:
I live in South Africa, Adding to what was said in this video, People in Africa in general know what contraceptives are I.E. Condoms and Birth Control, But don't use it because of the price and other reasons, Moving on our crime rate is terrible not only because of corruption and a lack of jobs but also lack of education, Corruption in Africa happens EVERYWHERE, Think Government, Hospitals, Schools, Insurance Companies, Police Departments, Electrical Companies for the country, Home affairs, Licencing Department (Where you apply for Driving Test both Theoretical and Practical) and many more, Education in public schools are so bad that our minimum pass rate for High school is 40% on each subject with some subjects only requiring 30%, There are schools that push you to achieve higher marks but those are in expensive private schools most of the time, as such we have university students calling science "Magic" or "Black Magic" if i remember correctly, Investments into the country have been stolen or misused, Our Electrical Company owes Billions, Municipalities owe billions to our electrical company as well as other companies, Squatter Camps are all over the country with next to no infrastructure in a lot of them, Education in these camps also doesn't exist in a lot of them because schools are too far away and the parents cannot take then due to a lack of transportation.
There are more issues you can go into with Africa that will have to be solved to help alleviate the issues with overpopulation, But it is going to take a lot of money and a lot of new laws as well as a new way to enforce them as even the Military and Police Force are corrupt.


Welcome to Africa.
